Judul: Comparing methods of 3-D acquisition of simulated multi-electrode resistivity data using TOPSIS
Abstrak:
The use of 3-D multi-electrode resistivity method has increased because they can account for variations in very
complex zones and as a function of major advancements in instruments, data inversion techniques and survey
configurations, including; complete (C), cross-diagonal (CD) and gamma (?). Most commonly, many cables
(including switch devices) are used in one continuous array. This traditional (T) method requires a large
investment in money to purchase the necessary cables (e.g. 8). An alternative is to use a smaller number of
cables (e.g. 4 or 2) using a roll-along (RA) method; whereby the smaller number of cables are set-up in
sequence to simulate one T. However, there are few if any case studies which demonstrate the advantages
or disadvantages to assist practitioners to decide which configuration may be most suitable for their required
purpose nor to demonstrate advantages and disadvantages in terms of criteria such as; non-uniformity, sensitivity, instrumentation cost and time of generating the 3-D model. In this paper, we describe the theory and
methodology of these survey methods and configurations and compare them using the four criteria using a
TOPSIS (Technique for Order Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution) method using a simulated 8 × 8 electrode grid. We also compare various number of cables. Specifically, we simulate the collection of resistivity
data with; 8 cables using C (8C), CD (8CD) and ? (8?), 4 cables using C (4C), CD (4CD) and ? (4?), and 2 cables
using C (2C), CD (2CD) and ? (2?). We conclude that the RA method using only 2 cables was preferable compared with the traditional (T) method using 8 cables and RA method using 4 cables. This was regardless of the
survey configurations (i.e. C, CD and ?). Of the configurations, the ? was preferred as it saves on time because it
collects a smaller number of data. However, the disadvantage of this configuration is that it has a relatively low
sensitivity.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Xiaopei Zhang, Lizhi Du, John Triantafilis
Kata Kunci: 3-D Multi-electrode resistivity survey Roll-along method TOPSIS method
